title: Add an option to confirm email address on signup
body:
Europe is launching a new law in May, called GDPR, which is great, but comes with a lot of constraints for anyone having a webservice.





One of the thing we need to do to be compliant is:





_With e-mail double opt-in, a new user first needs to verify their e-mail address before completing the sign-up process._





I've tried to prevent doing this on Monica since the beginning - not because I wanted to collect your email address and do nasty thing with it, but because I wanted people to sign up with fake email addresses if they wanted to.





This law will force us to confirm email addresses on signup.





We will create a new `.env` variable, called `SIGNUP_DOUBLE_OPTIN`, which will default to `TRUE`. On our hosted version, it will be set to true, but you will do whatever you want on your own instance.





Note: to be clear, we do have an email newsletter, but we only contact people who have subscribed manually and specifically to receive this newsletter. The email address used on signup is never used otherwise, other than sending reminder emails.





Changes to do:


- [ ] Create a email confirmation process


- [ ] Keep track of when the user has validated his email address


- [ ] Display this information in the Settings panel under a new section (called `Compliance`)


- [ ] Add a method in the User object, something like `isCompliant`, that will tell if users have confirmed emails and accepted Terms & Privacy. If not, we should block email sending (reminders, notifications,...) automatically. This will be done in https://github.com/monicahq/monica/issues/1184 so you don't have to do it here.





cc @asbiin @Mokto

title: GDPR
body:
Next month (May 2018), a new EU regulation will come into effect, concerning the privacy/ data protection of user data. This new regulation comes with very high potential sanctions: up to 20 Million EUR or 4% of a years revenue, depending on which is _higher_.





This also poses some questions on whether DokuWiki is GDPR-compliant (and what does that even mean?):





- [ ] If a user deletes their account, do we have to delete their username from changelogs/meta?


  - Question asked here: https://law.stackexchange.com/q/27795/17677


  - [ ] Would that potentially conflict with the license, if that license requires attribution?


- [ ] Do we have to delete IP-addresses from changelogs, maybe after some time?


  - [ ] Can we do that in a way that still lets us tell different anonymous users apart from each other?


- [ ] Do we need to show some message / do we need some legally worded user opt-in for some things? (Subscriptions?)


- [ ] Do we need a Privacy Statement for DokuWiki.org?


  - [ ] should we provide examples other users can adjust?


  - [ ] would it be desirable to extend that with technology (eg. automatically list what data is collected when, why and how long) and provide a way for plugins to hook into that?





Maybe some of you have expertise in this matter or work in a company with legal resources to answer such questions -- Input would be greatly appreciated 🙏

- [x] Updating the GDPR document should be communicated to members by email.


(additional warnings can be added based on codebase analysis)

title: [EU GDPR] [Feature Request] Provide log rotation option based on time
body:
**Description**





For the EU GDPR and other privacy laws, keeping logs only a limited amount of time (rather than a limited amount of overall data, like docker's `--log-opt max-buffer-size` allows) is essential to avoid fines for unnecessarily keeping sensitive data beyond a reasonable time window required for potential investigation of technical incidents.





Since this will affect a lot of those people who are using the docker engine directly (rather than an orchestrator like kubernetes) to run containers and manage their logs, I propose an option is added to handle this, e.g. `--log-opt max-buffer-days` or something. To handle this, docker would internally need to separate the log by days, so it can throw away not only based on overall log size but also based on age.





Sorry if such an option already exists, I made this ticket because I wasn't able to find it.





Edit: please note detailed "throw away granularity"/small interval, or a super exact throw away time (beyond not exceeding the interval) is really not required for this option to fulfill this use case. So I don't think any advanced detail intervals or making sure it's not thrown away a day *early* in some corner cases is important, and the simplest implementation that doesn't have horrible performance is probably good enough.

title: Suggest recipients from address book, not from user base
body:
We run a nextcloud server for several communities. The actual behaviour is a privacy issue and may force us to stop offering the service when the EU GDPR is applicable after 25th of May 2018.





### Steps to reproduce


1. Create an E-Mail message


2. Enter a few letters for the recipient





### Expected behaviour


Show recipients only from the user's address book he/she has access to (if address book app is available for that user), else show no proposal for a recipient. This restriction should be configurable as an option in the config.php for sites, which offers a nextcloud service outside organisational boundaries.





### Actual behaviour


Matching names from the total user base is shown. Any user can read any E-Mail address. 





### Mail app





**Mail app version:** 0.7.10





**Mailserver or service:** dovecot / postfix





**Number of accounts:** several hundreds





### Server configuration





**Version:** nextcloud 13





We have hidden nextclouds user search button with a custom CSS: 


```


#contactsmenu {


 	display: none;


}


```

title: Filter/whitelist response fields doesn't work as expected
body:
<!-- This form is for reporting bugs and issues specific to the WooCommerce plugin. This is not a support portal. If you need technical support from a human being, please submit a ticket via the helpdesk instead: https://woocommerce.com/contact-us/ -->





<!-- Usage questions can also be directed to the public support forum here: https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/woocommerce, unless this is a question about a premium extension in which case you should use the helpdesk. -->





<!-- If you have a feature request, submit it to: http://ideas.woocommerce.com/forums/133476-woocommerce -->





<!-- If you are a developer who needs a new filter/hook raise a PR instead :) -->





<!-- Please be as descriptive as possible; issues lacking the below details, or for any other reason than to report a bug, may be closed without action. -->





## Prerequisites





<!-- MARK COMPLETED ITEMS WITH AN [x] -->





- [x ] I have searched for similar issues in both open and closed tickets and cannot find a duplicate


- [ x] The issue still exists against the latest `master` branch of WooCommerce on Github (this is **not** the same version as on WordPress.org!)


- [ x] I have attempted to find the simplest possible steps to reproduce the issue


- [ ] I have included a failing test as a pull request (Optional)





## Steps to reproduce the issue





<!-- We need to be able to reproduce the bug in order to fix it so please be descriptive! -->





1. Use GET for orders and try to whitelist response fields like (notice attempt to whitelist nested object 'billing_address' fields): https://www.somedomain.com/wc-api/v2/orders?filter[created_at_min]=2018-04-23T08:17:11Z&filter[created_at_max]=2018-04-24T08:17:11Z&fields=id,order_number,created_at,billing_address.first_name,billing_address.last_name,billing_address.email


2. In response observe that our whitelist for nested object 'billing_address' produces only one field. Order of whitelisted fields is not important, always only last mentioned will be returned.


{"orders":[  


      {  


         "id":1624,


         "order_number":"1624",


         "created_at":"2018-04-18T09:08:46Z",


         "billing_address":{  


            "email":"someemail@test.com"


         }


      }


]}





## Expected/actual behavior





When I follow those steps, I see that in response not all whitelisted fields are returned.





I was expecting to see that when requesting to whitelist fields in nested objects, I would get those fields.





I see that API tries to provide this functionality (https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/46d3638089b58b51a2321b67443b83f409c6b4ec/includes/api/legacy/v2/class-wc-api-resource.php#L320), but fails, because of a problem in code, when the name of the object becomes a key in array and the value is overriden as many times as there are whitelisted fields for that object and only last remains to be whitelisted.





This is important for me, as I want to be GDPR compliant. I know I could just whitelist 'billing_address' field and be done with it, but I want to collect as little data as possible to comply with consent from user, not to mention the benefit of less bandwidth.





## Isolating the problem





<!-- MARK COMPLETED ITEMS WITH AN [x] -->





- [x ] This bug happens with only WooCommerce plugin active


- [ ] This bug happens with a default WordPress theme active, or [Storefront](https://woocommerce.com/storefront/)


- [ x] I can reproduce this bug consistently using the steps above





## WordPress Environment





<details>


I'm a third party, providing service for eshops and consuming their apis with their consent. So many versions possible.


</details>

title: Allow trashed events to be deleted and at the same time prevent them from orphaning other data records GDPR
body:
See original Codebase ticket:
https://events.codebasehq.com/projects/event-espresso/tickets/9009

This has come up in the forums and I think there's some room for improvement when it comes to making things easier for event managers.

Steps to reproduce: 
1) Set up an event and assign some people CPTs to the event, save the event.
2) Trash the event
3) Go the trashed events view in the wp admin list table
4) check the box next to the event
5) select the Delete Permanently action and click Apply

Result is you'll see some errors that say you can't delete the event. So now you have to go and restore the event from the trash, then you have to edit the event, and remove all of the relationships to things like People CPts. Then trash, then you can permanently delete.

Can we change the above so the relationships automatically get removed so all they'll have to do is trash then delete the event?

**[GDPR] Profiling**





Bumps `n-express` and forces the `withConsent` app option:


If the `FT-Consent` header is present (from preflight), parse its content into `res.locals.consent`:





```


ft-consent=marketingByemail:on,recommendedcontentOnsite:off


```





--->





```


res.locals.consent = {


 	marketingByemail: true,


 	recommendedcontentOnsite: false


}


```





See Financial-Times/next-preflight#304 for background on the `FT-Consent` header.

title: GDPR Checklist
body:
#### Summary





IP masking, anonymity sets, and no more cookies 





#### Checklist





Completed items are on `master` branch





- [x] Mask IPs with `Ahoy.mask_ips = true` (side effect: reduces geocoding accuracy)


- [x] Add `Ahoy.cookies = false` to function server-side without cookies


- [x] Add `Ahoy.configure({cookies: false})` to Ahoy.js to function client-side without cookies


- [x] Create readme instructions





#### IP Masking





Same approach as [Google Analytics IP Anonymization](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2763052)





- IPv4 - set last octet to 0


- IPv6 - set last 80 bits to zeros





#### Anonymity Sets & Cookies





Instead of cookies, use the following formula for visit and visitor tokens.





```


uuid_v5("visit(or)/#{masked_ip_address}/#{user_agent}")


```





Visitors with the same masked IP address (see above) and user agent combo will be grouped together into an [anonymity set](https://privacypatterns.org/patterns/Anonymity-set)





**Note:** Visits have an infinite duration - one approach is to add the current date/week to the hash, but this will interfere with active visits during switchover





#### Readme instructions





Update `config/initializers/ahoy.rb` to:





```ruby


class Ahoy::Store < Ahoy::DatabaseStore


  def authenticate(data)


    # do not link visits and users automatically


  end


end





Ahoy.mask_ips = true


Ahoy.cookies = false


```





If you use JavaScript tracking, set:





```js


ahoy.configure({cookies: false});


```





#### Notes





- Encryption: Should already to do this with `config.force_ssl`


- Data deletion: Data is stored in your data store, so already have full control





#### Resources





- [GDPR Checklist](https://gdprchecklist.io/)

title: Google Analytics. Simplification of wording, opt out or complete removal
body:
> Continuation: https://github.com/MediaBrowser/Emby/issues/3266 Apologies for posting in the wrong repository, I did not know that `advanced metric reporting` is restricted solely to `plugin.video.emby` and is not used anywhere else in the project.





Can I request the inclusion of options that allow Emby sysadmins to control in one central location all Emby uses of advanced metric reporting, aka Google analytics or alternatively that user data logging be removed from the project completely.





I have carefully worded this request to include all Emby uses of advanced metric reporting but my primary exposure to this has been surrounding the setting in the `Emby for Kodi Sync Add-On` https://emby.media/emby-for-kodi.html





As it stands each of my users are required to navigate to `Kodi > Addons > Emby > Configure > Advanced`  and disable "analytics metrics logging" on each of their profiles on each of their devices. This is impractical in general and impossible given the metrics are being collected are against my children who are all too young to understand any of this.





I would also like to request this setting be altered to use clearer wording explaining what it is as in my opinion the current wording does not naturally lend itself to informing users that data is being uploaded to the cloud for analysis.





Alternatively you may find it beneficial to consider removing all user data collection as you may not be aware of recent regulation changes covering to the collection of EU citizen data by any party worldwide. These changes are far reaching and amongst other things clear up the previous grey area of data being uploaded outside of the EU by non EU parties. This FAQ should help https://www.eugdpr.org/gdpr-faqs.htm and I would strongly recommend Emby LLC review this and instruct their authorised partners to do so too as compliance is mandatory and it has special regulations for children you will need to follow without delay.





Note: I seriously considered not raising this ticket in fear of it becoming some flag for nay sayers to rally behind. I would ask that people do not jump on this for anything other than technical or legal compliance as *Emby LLC and their authorised partners are absolutely within their rights to collect data* they just need to do it in the right way which unfortunately in a post GDPR world is a very complex and time-consuming task.

RIGHTS.PRINCIPLES: right to erasure, right to access

title: DS-5240 As a SM I want it to be clear to which Revisions user has given Consent
body:
## Problem


Can not filter user consents by state or revision.





## Solution


Create a page for showing last user consent and add filters by revision and state to this page.





## Issue tracker


- DS-5172


- DS-5240





## HTT


- [x] Enable **Social GDPR** module


- [x] Log in as SM


- [x] Create the first revision of data policy


- [x] Log in as X


- [x] Give your consent on the data policy


- [x] Log in as SM


- [x] Go to on **/admin/reports/data-policy-agreements**


- [x] You should see the **Data Policy Agreements** page


- [x] You should see the **Data policy revision** filter with one date in list


- [x] You should see the **State** filter which consist of thee checkboxes: **Agree**, **Not agree**, **Undecided**


- [x] You should see table with one row


- [x] You should see data policy revision created date in the **DATA POLICY REVISION** column


- [x] You should see the **X** user in the **USER** column


- [x] You should see the **Agree** state in the **STATE** column

## What does this change?


This PR contains three key pieces


- Adds an abstract-ish advert consent library & tests for setting ad consents


- Adds a very barebones Scala view to set said consents


- Adds a small react view (the radio buttons) to power the aforementioned Scala view





For now, I would like a review of the advert library as the other two bits are subject to change. I can split that in its own PR if you'd like but I feel like there's a benefit in having a basic end to end example of how this all ties together.





Ah, also my react is extremely rusty so please let me know if there's anything horribly deeply wrong in there!





The actual page is hidden under a switch as the setting is not actually honoured by the ads yet





## What is the value of this and can you measure success?


We get to continue showing personalised adverts after the GDPR cutoff date





## Does this affect other platforms - Amp, Apps, etc?


No





## Does this affect GLabs Paid Content Pages? Should it have support for Paid Content?


No

title: Opening Contact form with hashed URL
body:
Pre-populate Contact form (https://www.sensenet.com/contact) if opened with hashed URL





* There is already a mechanism that automatically generates a unique hashed URL to each content saved by the contact us form. Contact content - hashed URL pairs can be seen here: https://sncom.test.sensenet.com/contact/HashList (login required)


* If any user (visitor) clicks this URL, the Contact form fields should be pre-filled with data from the corresponding contact content that the form can display.


* If the corresponding contact content is missing (it has been deleted), no error message should be displayed, just display the empty contact form.


* URL should not expire at all, can be used any time and any number of times.





Please note relevant [Make Contact form GDPR compliant Contact form](https://github.com/SenseNet/sn-resources/issues/60) issue. Present story should only be deployed on live server if issue #60 has gone live.

title: Issues with Personal Data page (does not delete saved tokens when deleting user)
body:
It looks like the personal data pages were added with the EU GDPR regulations in mind, the pull is here:


#1559





However using the dotnet-sdk-2.1.300-rc1 identity scaffolded files, when deleting a user, any saved tokens for the user that are stored in the database table "AspNetUserTokens" are left behind so it is not fully deleting the user and their personal data. The User Claims are correctly deleted from "AspNetUserClaims" table. Not sure about other related tables as i haven't got around to trying out the roles etc.





This can easily be fixed by modifying the deletion code in the scaffolded files but really needs to be correct from the start.





Another issue is that when downloading personal data, the User Claims are not downloaded from the database, these are relevant as it is personal data that is stored in the database. Obviously if you have a custom user class and have added your own fields then you will need to update the download code to include them, but there is no reason that the claims should not be downloaded by default.





Technically any stored 3rd party provider access tokens should also be included in the download as it is still personal data. I think the hashed password of the local login doesn't count as personal data with it being a hash which is irreversible.

title: Remove GA script from site htmls in prep for GDPR.
Remove email in "password sent" URL (reduce personal data)
body:
We're mentioning the email address on the success screen after using the "lost password" form. That means email addresses (personal data) is stored in web server logs, referers etc - that's making it harder to comply to regulations like GDPR. We should remove this email data from the URL, either into PHP sessions or (preferrably) by just not requiring this info on the screen.





See https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/issues/7791 for context





PRs:





 * [x] https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/pull/8223


 * [x] https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-admin/pull/561

Background of this change:


In April, 2016, the European Union’s governing bodies passed the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), a set of standards and requirements for protecting the privacy and personal information of EU residents. These requirements serve to establish a uniform standard across all EU member states, but do raise the bar above current general practice. They go into effect, in May, 2018.

title: iOS/Android: Add GDPR Compliance
body:
### Included Tickets





Android: https://jira.appcelerator.org/browse/MOD-2423


iOS: https://jira.appcelerator.org/browse/MOD-2422





### Downloads (prerelease, do not use in production)





- [ti.admob-iphone-2.3.0.zip](https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.admob/files/2030061/ti.admob-iphone-2.3.0.zip)


- [ti.admob-android-4.1.0.zip](https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.admob/files/2034680/ti.admob-android-4.1.0.zip)





### Notes





- For iOS, the `extras` have already been exposed on the `AdView` instance and can conform to GDPR by including the `npa` key. Example:


```js


var adView = AdMob.createAdView({


  // -- Other parameters here --


  extras: {


    'npa': '1' // Disable personalized ads


  }


});


```


- For Android, `extras` should be passed to `requestAd`. Example:


```js


AdMob.requestAd({


  extras: {


    'npa': '1' // Disable personalized ads


  }


});


```


- Exposed `Consent SDK` API's:





| API | iOS | Android |


| --- | ---- | --------|


| `disableSDKCrashReporting()` | ✅ | Available via Play-Services? |


| `disableAutomatedInAppPurchaseReporting()` | ✅ | Available via Play-Services? |


| `requestConsentInfoUpdateForPublisherIdentifiers()` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `showConsentForm(args)` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `reset()` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `setTagForUnderAgeOfConsent(true\|false)` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `isTaggedForUnderAgeOfConsent()` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `consentStatus` \* | ✅ | ✅ |


| `debugGeography` \*\* | ✅ | ✅ |


| `adProviders` | ✅ | ✅ |


| `debugIdentifiers` | ✅ | Not available on Android |





\* One of `CONSENT_STATUS_UNKNOWN`, `CONSENT_STATUS_NON_PERSONALIZED` or `CONSENT_STATUS_PERSONALIZED`


\*\* One of `DEBUG_GEOGRAPHY_DISABLED`, `DEBUG_GEOGRAPHY_EEA` or `DEBUG_GEOGRAPHY_NOT_EEA`

title: Complete removing cookies panel
body:
**Je naplánováno ukončení provozu této lišty.** Důvody jsou dva:





1. Provoz hostingu lišty platím ze své kapsy a není to levná sranda (viz #12),


2. v návaznosti na GDPR vydalo ÚOOÚ nové stanovisko (viz dále).





Lištu klidně používejte dál, pokud je pro Vás důležitá, jen si ji musíte zkopírovat na svůj web (viz níže).





## Podrobnosti


Úřad pro ochranu osobních údajů [ve svém včerejším doporučení](https://www.uoou.cz/cookies-a-nbsp-gdpr/d-29966) představil nové pojetí pohledu na Cookies ve vztahu k ochraně osobních údajů, ze kterého vyplývá, že tato lišta již není potřeba pro drtivou většinu jejích reálných implementací.





Po dobu provozu jsem různými způsoby monitoroval, jakým způsobem je lišta používána – pouze jeden web použil pokročilé možnosti lišty, kterými skutečně podmínil sbírání údajů o uživatelích. Všechny ostatní implementace považuju nyní za nadbytečné a postrádající smysl, protože neplní žádnou užitečnou funkci, ani zákonné nařízení a pouze obtěžují uživatele.





Další informace na serveru e-legal: [Úřad pro ochranu osobních údajů prolomil mlčení ohledně cookies](http://www.e-legal.cz/clanky/urad-pro-ochranu-osobnich-udaju-prolomil-mlceni-ohledne-cookies)





Z tohoto důvodu jsem se rozhodl ukončit existenci této lišty. Lišta nyní bude zobrazovat upozornění a ke dni 1. 9. 2018 bude z hostingu odstraněna.





### Harmonogram ukončení


- [x] Od 23. 5. 2018: jemné upozornění (#15) s odkazem na tuto issue


- [x] Od 1. 6. 2018: viditelnější upozornění (#16 - změna ikonky na výrazně červenou + varování přes [`console.warn()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/warn))


- [x] Od 1. 7. 2018: logování varování pomocí [`console.error()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/error) (#17)


- [x] Od 1. 9. 2018: vypnutí lišty – místo zobrazení bude kód logovat chybu přes [`console.error()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Console/error) a současně vyhodí [`throw Error`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error) (#18)


- [x] Od 1. 1. 2019: vypnutí CDN a změna S3 bucketu na privátní (bude vracet chybu 403).





## Stažení původní funkční lišty


Pokud však z nějakého důvodu trváte na použití této lišty, stahněte si lištu ze [stránky poslední funkční verze lišty](https://github.com/jakubboucek/fucking-eu-cookies/releases/latest). Případně můžete využít neoficiální fork na CDN (nejsem autorem): https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/eu-cookie-law





Jsem otevřen diskuzi, pokud jste jiného názoru. Chcete-li sledovat vývoj, přihlaste si odběr tohoto vlákna (Subscribe).

title: Anonymizes data in Rogue so that we're compliant with GDPR
body:
#### What's this PR do?


This PR anonymizes data in Rogue so that we're compliant with GDPR:


- Changes all EU member signups' `why_participated` to be `EU Member. Removed because of GDPR`.


- Changes all EU member posts' `text` to be `EU Member. Removed because of GDPR`.


- Deletes all EU member posts' image URLs from s3 and changes them to `NULL` in the database. 


- Tags all EU member posts as "Hide In Gallery" 


- All of the above is changed for all records, even if they have been soft deleted. 





#### How should this be reviewed?


👀 


Did I miss anything that we need to do here? 





#### Relevant tickets


Fixes [this](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/2019429/stories/157709055) Pivotal Card.





#### How to deploy


https://github.com/DoSomething/rogue/blob/master/docs/development/deployments.md

title: Update information-collection.md
body:
Update this and be a little more explicit about what we're collecting. InTheory, Metabase can be considered first party software if it's hosted by a given Data Controller. 





Regardless, we should play more nicely with GDPR requirements if we spell things out a little more clearly. Of specific note is that PII is _never_ sent to us in any form from an instance server-side, and that we use GA to better understand and build the product, but aren't enriching or otherwise passing on that data.

title: Don't provide IP addresses from failed logins
body: The GDPR report also contains IP addresses from the failed logins log. This might not be the best idea due to the fact, that the given ip addresses may not belong to the account holder. So you are currently possibly providing ip addresses from other people within a user's report.

title: theming app should offer links to imprint AND privacy policy
body:
In light of GDPR we are missing the option to set up a link to our privacy policy on the login screen.





Currently, it’s only possible to set a link to an imprint via the theming app (1.4.2). But we need both; an imprint and a privacy policy.





(A further generalization for this would be to be able to add any number of custom links to the footer of the page with both a custom link and custom label.)

title: Make /setuid handler GDPR-aware
body:
# Requirements


The uids cookie must only be set in the following conditions:


- If gdpr=0, the uids cookie may be set.


- Else both of these conditions must be true:


    - The user must allow local storage -- If gdpr is 1 and the consent string allows Purpose 1


    - The PBS host company must have consent -- If gdpr is 1 and the consent string allows the PBS host company's vendor ID as defined in config





If gdpr is undefined in request, gdpr.in-scope-by-default configuration value will be applied as value of "gdpr" query parameter (name of this configuration property must be mentioned in the document describing differences between Java and Go implementation since in Go implementation it is called "gdpr.usersync_if_ambiguous" currently).





This library could be used for consent string parsing: https://github.com/InteractiveAdvertisingBureau/Consent-String-SDK-Java

title: GDPR/WHOIS certificate validation issues
body:
To comply with GDPR, domain registrars have stopped including email addresses in WHOIS query results. It's not consistent across the board, but here is an example from moniker.com: https://faq.moniker.com/my-account/european-general-data-protection-regulation-gdpr





Currently aws-web-stacks tells AWS to validate the requested domain using 'email validation'. AWS sends the email an email to 5 specified accounts at the domain in question (like 'admin', 'webmaster', etc) and then also to the 3 emails listed as the Registrant, Technical, and Administrative contact in WHOIS. Those last 3 will no longer be available if the registrar is now hiding them. If you happen to have mail set up for the domain, then you're OK because one of the first 5 accounts should receive the email.





If not, however, the email will never get to you, cert approval will fail, and the stack will get rolled back. For subdomains like foo.example.com, you're probably not going to want to set up a MX record for each subdomain.





I'm not sure of the best solution, but wanted to open up this issue to track it.

title: Privacy policy
body:
Due to the nature of the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Rules, the community is required to maintain a Privacy Policy that is compliant with the new rules. This PR is the living draft of that new Privacy Policy and we want to give the community time to review it before we publish it officially.





@voxpupuli/collaborators Everyone please take part in reviewing and contributing to the discussion surrounding the Vox Pupuli Privacy Policy.

title: Privavy Policy will be replaced with eula
body:
We will ad an eula instead of only to mention privavy policy because of GDPR. We did this to be on the **"safe side"**

U Team Core Eula

This Eula only applies to original releases of U Team Core on Curse Forge. The source code is available under the Apache 2 License on github.

By downloading and/or using U Team Core ("Mod"), you hereby permit the Mod and any software which has a hard dependency ("Child Mods") on the Mod to use your internet connection to request non-malicious information/content from third-party sources such as *.u-team.info, github.com, central.maven.org and other sources. Please checkout their privacy policies for further information. They will get you ip and might collect statistic data. You also permit, but may opt out of in the configuration file ("config/uteamcore.cfg"), the Mod to collect and use, your Minecraft Account UUID (This cannot be used to access your Mojang Account), your IP address which will not be publicly disclosed (We would have this information if you visited a website anyways), as well as several information about your runtime environment.
With our Client we collect:

  • Country
  • Language
  • Cpu
  • Operating system
  • Graphics card and driver
  • Java version
  • Allocated Ram
  • Minecraft, Forge and UTeamCore version
  • Obfuscated environment or default
  • Installed mods

We use "Content Delivery Network" (CDN) from Cloudflare, Inc., 101 Townsend St, San Francisco, CA 94107, US. Cloudflare is certified under the Privacy Shield Agreement, providing a guarantee to comply with European privacy legislation. ( https://www.privacyshield.gov/participant?id=a2zt0000000GnZKAA0&status=Active)
Cloudflare Privacy Policy https://www.cloudflare.com/security-policy

You accept that the Mod is provided without warranty; software support will be given where possible. You will also not hold HyCraftHD ("Author") and other official contributors liable for any damage or harm caused to your machinery, self or any objects/biological beings around you. Contributions by the official contributors will be thoroughly screened/managed by the Author to ensure it is working as intended by the Author without any malicious intent. If any damage or harm has indeed been pinpointed to the Mod as the cause, this is completely unintentional and the issue in the Mod will be fixed/resolved as soon as possible.

You understand that any downloads of the Mod not originating from Curse Network, may be modified without knowledge of the Author and may be malicious, and will not hold the Author responsible. In the event that any downloads originating from the Website are indeed malicious, it is entirely unintentional and will be rectified once the Author has been notified.

You accept that if you are redistributing the Mod to other users without their agreement of this EULA and they were to use the Mod, you therefore hold yourself accountable for any conflict or problem that occurs and will be held responsible. This includes but is not limited to any of the other users disagreeing to any data collection done by the Mod.

You accept that the EULA may change at any time without prior notice. However, the EULA will never change to allow The Mod and Author to intentionally introduce malicious content to your system.

title: Show privacy policy and log user consent for GDPR compliance
body:
To be compliant with EU GDPR, registration should have an option to show the privacy policy of the nextcloud instance to the user and prompt for consent.
Actual "Theming" had this implemented some days ago (without the consent).

Without this, registration is legally not usable in many cases within the EU or with EU based users if you do not get user consent another way.

The **active** user consent (no pre-filled checkbox) should be logged to the database (ideally together with the version of the displayed privacy policy).

title: GDPR, Github Pages and Matomo
body:
Hobbyists, that are using GitHub Pages for their project, they need to have Matomo installed on a different subdomain. E. g. the main page is at `example.com` and the Matomo installation is reachable at `analytics.example.com`.





As a hobbyist, I wonder what exactly I have to do to become GDPR complaint. Assume that the only thing I want to know is how the site is doing (visists per day and maybe returning visit rate). Since the actual page on `example.com` runs on GitHub Pages, the hobbyist does not have access to the server log.





Does one need a cookie-notice in this case? What about cookies in the first place? Do I need a privacy policy? Or does the "anonymize IP addresses" checkbox on the last page of the setup suffice?

The banner functionality and text have a new settings panel under Admin->Settings called "Privacy Notification" - here the GDPR banner functionality can be deactivated, and the message can be customized. The GDPR will be ON by default. Also added a new privacy message static page which is linked from the Quick Links menu as well as from the notification banner.

title: Check for any credit cards [not just qualified] at auction registration
body:
Depends on https://github.com/artsy/metaphysics/pull/1093 [merged]





Tracked here:


https://artsyproduct.atlassian.net/browse/PURCHASE-190








This PR makes removes an inconsistency in our checks for the new GDPR auction registration flow. Instead of checking whether a user `has_qualified_credit_cards` we are now just checking for `has_credit_cards` (the metaphyics PR above adds this field & is thus a blocker).





It addresses a bug due to a common issue with cards outside North America failing some checks.

title: Add error handling around Elasticsearch update/delete.
body:
https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/PLAT-2164





The GDPR user retirement pipeline has experienced some rare issues with forum user retirement failing due to attempting to update a non-existent record in Elasticsearch. Adds error-handling around Elasticsearch updates/deletes.

title: Conflict with ActiveStorage
body:
I had some trouble with ActiveStorage and the GDPR export gem, and in fact logged it with the Rails core team. 


https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/32933





They finally replied saying we should not use models in initialisers 





> There are two problem on loading Active Record models in initializers, one of them is that it will mess with the code reload, those models may not be able to be reloaded anymore.





In the end I followed this gem's code and modified the approach for [crowdAI](https://github.com/crowdAI/crowdai)





- [Initializer](https://github.com/crowdAI/crowdai/blob/master/config/initializers/gdpr.rb)


- [Export code: in the mailer - could be extracted](https://github.com/crowdAI/crowdai/blob/master/app/mailers/gdpr_export_mailer.rb#L65-L87)


- [Tests](https://github.com/crowdAI/crowdai/blob/master/spec/mailers/gdpr_export_mailer_spec.rb)

title: Displaying cookie information
body:
Hi Segment, 





A feature currently required by the Cookie Law and GDPR is to be able to list and display cookies inside of the the _Privacy Policy page_. 





You are currently able to do this in the Consent Banner Modal, would there be a way to "embed" the same information into a post in any way, using a script? 





If not that would be a great feature that consent manager solutions are offering (and currently require me to use both segment + another cookie solution at the same time on my sites).





Cheers, 


Bruno

title: Remove retrofit
Washington Post paywall
body:
Replace the bracketed [...] placeholders with your own information.





### URL(s) where the issue occurs





Any wapo url apart from the homepage, e.g. `https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/china-fires-back-at-us-tariffs-vows-to-defend-its-core-interests/2018/07/06/f42fc812-8091-11e8-a63f-7b5d2aba7ac5_story.html`, after you've viewed 5 pages.





### Describe the issue





A paywall box appears on the screen, and the URL in the address bar is changed to the homepage. Zapping the element doesn't work, as the article has been truncated. If you hit ESC at the right time (just before the address changes), you can stop the paywall activating without having to use an incognito window.





### Screenshot(s)





![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285430/42380957-88359128-8127-11e8-8367-467a4be36df5.png)





### Versions





- Browser/version:





Google Chrome | 67.0.3396.99 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)


-- | --


Revision | a337fbf3c2ab8ebc6b64b0bfdce73a20e2e2252b-refs/branch-heads/3396@{#790}





- uBlock Origin version: Nano Adblocker 1.0.0.55, Nano Defender 15.0.0.5





### Settings





- None





### Notes





Using an incognito window is annoying because you have to go through the GDPR warning again, and it only lasts for 5 pages before you need to close the window and start again. Hitting ESC before the address changes will stop the paywall and allow you to read the article, but the timing is very tight and comments can't be read on the article. I wonder if it's possible to have the paywall script stopped as a matter of course in Nano Defender? Thanks.





EDIT: I found this: https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/38567-washington-post-paywall-bypass - it works as a temporary stopgap but it means I need TamperMonkey running. I guess I'm hoping for this to be implemented in Nano directly so I don't need to also have TamperMonkey for one script.

title: Social Share buttons are only available for registered users
body:
**Describe the bug**


https://www.kunena.org/forum/general-questions-and-how-tos/153355-social-share-buttons





**To Reproduce**


Steps to reproduce the behavior:


1. Choose in the template setting Display Social Share = Yes


2. Visit your Forum as guest





**Expected behavior**


Social Share should be available





**Actual result**


Guests can't see the buttons





**Additional context**


But when we make Social Share available to guests, then makes the profile setting "Social Share - Yes or No" no sense.


As soon as a member log out, the Social Share buttons are back, also if in their profile is set "Social Share - No".


My opinion, it is the task of the website operator to inform his users about privacy (GDPR)  and to define if there are Social Share on his website or not.





**System information (please complete the following information)**





Joomla version: 3.8.10 and 3.8.11-dev


Kunena version: 5.1.2-dev


Php version: 7.0.25 and 7.2.1


Database version:

title: Added configuration of host names and ports for GDPR-qsg.sh
Loading services on entry page once a user signals their approval by continuing to navigate
body:
I'll set up a scenario to explain the issue:





A site that uses Google Analytics is configured using tarteaucitron. A visitor comes to the site and does not activate the third party services by scrolling past a certain point or clicking OK - they signal their acceptance by navigating to another page on the site.





The problems with this:





1) The visit metric for the first page is lost along with any referrer information because Google Analytics is only loaded by the time they get to their second page of browsing the site.


2) Referrer information is lost as when Google Analytics is loaded it will appear that the referrer is the first page that the user visited.





Per Recital 32 of the GDPR:


"...Consent should be given by a clear affirmative act establishing a freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject’s agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her, such as ... conduct which clearly indicates in this context the data subject’s acceptance of the proposed processing of his or her personal data."





I would like to explore peoples thoughts around the idea of initialising the services (or at least those that you deem important for your purposes on first page load), once a user clicks a link to navigate (i.e. has given their consent), is it worth providing a configurable option that slightly delays the navigation to the next page to give the opportunity for some services to load and do their reporting (e.g. Google Analytics reporting the entry page visit and maintaining referrer information).





I'd like to hear opinions on whether this is feasible or a feature that people would like?

title: Hide Participants name & Add an option to choose if you want to be featured
body: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** In the event's page there are 10 names displayed at participants. Sone concers related to this - This doesn't feel very private for me. I do not remember having a notice while registering telling me that my name will be displayed online. - Some names are just one letter or so - not feeling the participation as a real one - there are 10 displayed on 3 columns - on desktop there will be one on the 4th line alone, on mobile it is in the middle. 9 (3x) would be better * The list is written in very small text, aligned to left when all the page is middle'd **Describe the solution you'd like** * Solution 1: * Hide participants * Solution 2: * If we decide to keep it add * 1) A tick option to inform people you will add their names - they can opt out. * 2) Add the last 9 ones ( 3 X 3 ) **Describe alternatives you've considered** Any of the Solutions would work in a way **Additional context** * Under EU law we need to consider GDPR * We - at Mozilla - value privacy, I really feel we missed this part here. **Screnshoot** ![screenshot from 2018-09-05 15-34-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1391451/45093527-5309fa00-b121-11e8-9e51-3c5189ed36bb.png)

privacy api class: added
body:
Moodle uses a privacy API for GDPR compliance to allow plugins to specify how they deal with user data. Your plugin doesn't appear to store any user data so you can probably implement the null provider class. 


Sites that use continuous integration processes will not be able to use your plugin because Moodle runs unit tests which check to see if all extra plugins include the privacy class.





More information on the privacy class is here:


https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Privacy_API





Please note - this issue is not a blocker for approval in the plugins db, but it would be nice to add.

title: Fjerner alle lover fra legal_documents.json der lovens tittel ikke skal overskrives
body:
Bygger på 


* universitetsforlaget/lov-editor-backend#49


* https://github.com/universitetsforlaget/juridika-frontend/pull/310





_Må ikke merges før https://github.com/universitetsforlaget/juridika-frontend/pull/310 og https://github.com/universitetsforlaget/elasticsearch-indexer/pull/90 er merget._





Tanken her er at betydningen av `legal_documents.json` har endret seg fra å være hovedkilden til hvilke lover vi lister på Juridika (https://juridika.no/kommentarer), til at dette nå hentes fra database og `legal_documents.json` nå brukes kun for å overskrive _tittelen_ på disse lovene, der hvor de skal listes med en annen tittel på forsiden enn på selve loven.





---





Hvilke lover som har endret seg ble funnet automatisk på følgende måte:





```


$ psql "postgresql://localhost:5432/commentdb?options=--timezone%3DEurope/Oslo --search_path%3Dlover" uf





SELECT '/akn/no/act/' || id_doc_type || '/' || id_date || '/' || id_year_seq || '  ' || 


  array_to_string(xpath(


    '/akn:akomaNtoso/akn:act/akn:preface//akn:shortTitle/text()',


    content,


    '{{akn,http://docs.oasis-open.org/legaldocml/ns/akn/3.0/WD17}}'


  ), '')


FROM consolidated_law_document_latest_expr_published_only


ORDER BY id_doc_type, id_date, id_year_seq


;





<kopier outputen>





$ pbpaste | trim > /tmp/from_db.txt





$ cat $UF_DIR/static_content/legal_documents.json | jq 'map((.exprId | ("/akn/no/act/" + .type + "/" + .date + "/" + (.seq | tostring))) + "  " + (.shortTitle | gsub("^\\s+|\\s+$"; ""))) | .[]' | sed -e 's/"//g' | sort > /tmp/from_static_content.txt





$ comm -3 <(cat /tmp/from_static_content.txt | sort) <(cat /tmp/from_db.txt | sort)


/akn/no/act/lov/1902-05-22/10  Straffeloven 1902 (Opphevet) - (strl. 1902)


  /akn/no/act/lov/1902-05-22/10  Straffeloven 1902 - (strl. 1902)


/akn/no/act/lov/1980-06-13/24  Ligningsloven (Opphevet) - (lignl)


  /akn/no/act/lov/1980-06-13/24  Ligningsloven - (opphevet)


  /akn/no/act/lov/1997-05-23/31  Eierseksjonsloven - (eiersl)


/akn/no/act/lov/1997-05-23/31  Eierseksjonsloven 1997 (Opphevet) - (eiersl)


  /akn/no/act/lov/2001-05-18/21  Straffegjennomføringsloven


/akn/no/act/lov/2001-05-18/21  Straffegjennomføringsloven Kapittel 5


  /akn/no/act/lov/2006-05-19/16  Offentleglova


/akn/no/act/lov/2006-05-19/16  Offentleglova - (offl)


/akn/no/act/lov/2016-04-27/679  Personvernforordningen (GDPR)


  /akn/no/act/lov/2016-04-27/679  Personvernforordningen - (GDPR)


```





Det er altså følgende lover det gjelder (samme som nevnt i beskrivelsen av https://github.com/universitetsforlaget/lov-editor-backend/pull/49):


* Straffeloven 1902


* Ligningsloven


* Eierseksjonsloven


* Straffegjennomføringsloven


* Personvernforordningen (GDPR)





Offentleglova kan ignoreres, den er bare med i lista fordi den ikke har fått en forkortelse i XMLen i databasen, men det skal Rolf nå legge til.


(Merk: Denne lista kan se litt anderledes ut om samme kommandoer kjøres senere, ettersom Rolf fikser datagrunnlaget ifm https://trello.com/c/M6yQmHQM/321-noen-lover-har-dobbel-punktum-etter-forkortelsen-under-om-loven)

title: RecordFetching event not triggering in the backoffice
body:
Hi guys,





I've been working with my colleague Dennis on some new features of our awesome "Umbraco Forms on Steroids"-package to make it more GDPR-compliant. We have been working to realize some important parts of my blogpost and HTML mockup (https://skrift.io/articles/archive/i-have-a-nightmare-dream-about-umbraco-and-gdpr/, http://downloads.perplex.eu/umbraco/gdpr/settings2.html). 





Specifically we've been working on "delete data after x period" and encryption of the data.





The "delete data after x period" is already fixed with a workflow, and we will also do the encryption with a workflow. But when retrieving the data in the backoffice we have a problem and hopefully you can take a look shortly, so we can fix this and release the new and improved package. 





We hoped that we could decrypt the data when plugging into the event 





RecordStorage.RecordFetching += RecordStorage_RecordFetching;





So if we clicked on "Entries" in the backoffice forms-section this would get called and we could decrypt every record. But this isn't triggered and if we sneakpeek into the dll we see that the functions GetAllRecords and GetRecords in RecordStorage.cs do not dispatch this event (it does in GetRecord and GetRecordByUniqueID), and that is why we can't decrypt data.





Could you think for just a moment how we could achieve the decryption in the backoffice without rewriting whole parts of the work you've done?





=== 


Submitted a Ticket to ZenDesk and Dennis asked me to add this to the issue:





The change is fairly simple as it just involves dispatching the event in those two methods of RecordStorage.cs (you can leave a note for whoever picks up the issue that it's line 76 and 132).





I'd however like that someone with Forms knowledge verifies that this approach is okay and that we do not cause any performance issues by triggering this as separate single events for each record, instead of batching it up with a new event type.





I don't think there will be any major issues though, as we also currently fetch the data for every single record through a foreach loop but would just like to be sure ;)





=== 


Hopefully this can be fixed soon!





Jeffrey

title: Actions from Code of Fundraising Practice review
body:
Includes discussion points, actions for Pat, and actions for Denise

ACTIONS:

 - [x] Pat (Twitter) re 10.2

 - [x] Act on decision from Fundraising Regulator (if there is one) - 10.2 Fees on Fundraising Platforms

 - [x] Check (Pat to email all to check) legally required info is on all comms that explicitly or implicitly talks about money (inc donations, requests for used cartridges, orders to suppliers)  https://knowhow.ncvo.org.uk/how-to/how-to-make-sure-you-include-the-right-information-about-your-charity-on-official-documents has what to include - 9.1.6

- [x] Pat to update our GDPR assessment spreadsheet with matters raised by the Fundraising Regulator (and ICO, in due course, if there are any)
 - [x] Pat to contact ICO re 2 queries not answered by the Fundraising Regulator

 - [x] Check 3rd party donation systems are clear about fees  - Pat to ask Fundrasing Regulator about Paypal - does not mention fees. Kindlink is OK.

 - [X] Check they have security measure (verified by visa/ securecode)  Both do.

 - [x] Pat to Check meaning of 10.4.1 You must not send bulk emails from
a named person’s email account. with Fundraising regulator

 - [x] Add to our  privacy policy - must clearly and expressly indicate that all PayPal transactions are subject to the PayPal Privacy Policy, the Kindlink Privacy policy (etc.).. see also 3.5.9 on purposes

 - [x] Add notice about privacy to the FreeBMD 

 - [x] Add generic donations preamble to FUG

  - [x] Update FreeBMD with fees levied on Paypal  -  issue with Fundraising regulator

 - [x]  Check point size of GDPR consent (should be as large as name/address or specifying donation amount or 10pt where neither) Needed for new Wordpress site, for Marketing purpose

 - [x] Implement response to email to fundraising regulator sent 20 July 2021

title: Login disable - why is it there and why is it an endless 403 loop with no information?
body:
Currently Mastodon supports "Login Disabled" sort of suspension:


> A Mastodon account can be disabled. This prevents the user from doing anything with the account, but all of the content is still there untouched. This limitation is reversible, the account can be re-enabled at any time. This limitation is only available for local users on your server.





https://docs.joinmastodon.org/usage/moderation/#disable-login





And it's all sorts of wrong:





1. When this suspension is applied to the user they cannot log out. 


They will see 403 unless they clear session cookies manually.  


2. If user manages to log back in they will be stuck in 403 again, untill sessions cookies are cleared manually.  


3. There's no indication what's going on.


4. User is not able to delete or export their data or access any other settings such as redirect account etc.  





Why is this feature even here? It's clear abuse of power and forced data retention which as I've pointed out in a previous issue is GDPR incompliant https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/issues/8760 





"You cannot login but you can't delete or export your data either, indefinitely".

title: [Livechat] Offline visitor seen as online
body:
### Description:





Offline visitor seen as online if the server goes down.





### Steps to reproduce:





1. Visitor opens a new room.


2. Server goes down.


3. Visitor disconnects.


4. Server goes up again.





### Expected behavior:





The visitor status should be offline.





### Actual behavior:





The visitor status is still online.





### Server Setup Information:





- Version of Rocket.Chat Server: Last dev version


- NodeJS Version: v9.11.2





### Additional context





That is important if due to GDPR you want an automatic process that continuously removes all the offline chat records, just as an example.

body:
This PR adds analytics tracking to ForceCode.





Features and notes:


-Will ask the user if they are OK with us tracking usage and error data (GDPR Compliance) and will remember the choice per project folder


-If a user opts-in, a unique UUID is assigned (Right now this is per project, this may need to change as I believe there's now a way for extensions to store data in their own folders for VSCode)


-Sends the ForceCode version number, OS, category (Currently have errors and starts of the extension), and a message (Error message or generic)


-This is currently tied to my personal GA Id, I made a new "Account" in my analytics specifically for ForceCode


-Packages will need updated via npm ci

title: FreshRSS 1.12.0
body:
The past month has seen a number of nice improvements in FreshRSS, in particular the possibility to add custom labels (tags), a long awaited feature 😃 


So let's start testing the /dev branch (also available via Docker) before releasing [FreshRSS 1.12.0](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/milestones/1.12.0).





[Changelog](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/blob/dev/CHANGELOG.md):


* Features


	* Ability to add *labels* (custom tags) to articles [#928](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/issues/928)


		* Also available through Google Reader API (full support in News+, partial in FeedMe, EasyRSS). No support in Fever API.


	* Handle article tags containing spaces, as well as comma-separated tags [#2023](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2023)


	* Handle authors containing spaces, as well as comma or semi-colon separated authors [#2025](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2025)


	* Searches by tag, author, etc. accept Unicode characters [#2025](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2025)


	* New option to disable cache for feeds with invalid HTTP caching [#2052](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2052)


* UI


	* New theme *Swage* [#2069](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2069)


	* Click on authors to initiate a search by author [#2025](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2025)


	* Fix CSS for button alignments in older Chrome versions [#2020](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2020)


	* Updated to jQuery 3.3.1 [#2021](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2021)


	* Updated to bcrypt.js 2.4.4 [#2022](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2022)


* Security


	* Improved flow for password change (avoid error 403) [#2056](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/issues/2056)


	* Allow dot `.` in username (best to avoid, though) [#2061](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/issues/2061)


* Performance


	* Remove some counterproductive preload / prefetch rules [#2040](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2040)


	* Improved fast flush (earlier transfer, fetching of resources, and rendering) [#2045](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2045)


		* Only available for Apache running PHP as module (not for NGINX, or PHP as CGI / FPM) because we want to keep compression


* Deployment


	* Fix Docker bug with some cron values [#2032](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2032)


	* Perform `git clean -f -d -f` (removes unknown files and folders) before git auto-update method [#2036](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2036)


* Bug fixing


	* Make article GUIDs case-sensitive also with MySQL [#2077](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/issues/2077)


	* Ask confirmation for important configuration actions [#2048](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2048)


	* Fix database size in the Web UI for users about to be deleted [#2047](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2047)


	* Fix actualize bug after install [#2044](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2044)


	* Fix manual / Web actualize for which the final commit coud be done too early [#2081](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2081)


	* Fix regression from version 1.11.2, which might have wrongly believed that the server address was private [#2084](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2084)


		* Please check in `data/config.php` that you have `'pubsubhubbub_enabled' => true,` if your server has a public address


* Extensions


	* Update built-in extension to again fix Tumblr feeds from European Union due to GDPR [#2053](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2053)


* I18n


	* Fix missing German translations, e.g. for *Sharing with Known* [#2059](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/pull/2059)


* Misc.


	* Better port detection behind a proxy [#2031](https://github.com/FreshRSS/FreshRSS/issues/2031)

title: Add privacy api support
body:
This PR adds the Moodle Privacy API (GDPR) support to the plugin.





I've also updated the minimum version of Moodle the plugin will work with, as the privacy implementation uses PHP 7 style type hinting. We can also use the legacy polyfil if required, but it is better to be moving forward.





I added the null provider privacy class to the plugin. This means that the plugin doesn't store user information. This was a tough call. From my understanding of the plugin, even though the plugin is very flexible it won't store user data. As plugin configuration generally doesn't either. The settings defined in this plugin may cause the plugin it is extending to store data, but this is the responsibility of that plugin.





We can always change this approach in the future

title: Make plugin GDPR compliant
body:

title: Robert Bennett Page has Embedded Code that Sends Info to External Third Party (GDPR Compliance Issue)
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19745467/48664504-6adcf300-ea6d-11e8-9339-146a0e469526.png)





Need image that does not have code script embedded in it.  As image is not owned by Ketch we cannot manipulate it, must ask source to provide image that doesn't have site data collection in it.  Instead we can provide a link in the image to Robert's site of choice.   However we cannot have script code in images as we cannot serve that without legal declaration and asking user for approval to send information to third party (which is a killer to do on web).  


[report-ketchpartners-1440948.pdf](https://github.com/KetchPartners/ketchpartnerswebsite/files/2592126/report-ketchpartners-1440948.pdf)

title: TC - Sep18 minutes for markup only
body:
****OpenWIS** TC meeting -- September 2018 (Sept. 7th**)





1.	**Welcome, introductions and approval of agenda**


        Present:


KS - Kuldeep Srivastava (KS) India Meteorological Department (IMD)


SO - Steve Olson (SO) representing National Weather Service (NWS) - Chair


WQ - Weiqing Qu (WQ), Bureau of Meteorology (BoM)


DW - Dominic Woollatt, UK Meteorological Office (UKMO)


JA - Jude Anthonisz, UK Meteorological Office (UKMO)


BS - Benjamin Saclier, Météo-France, France (MF) - Vice-chair


DP – David Podeur, Météo-France, France (MF)


    


    Apologies:


SS - Stephan Siemen (SS), European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF)





    Not present:


SSDo- Sungsoo Do (SD), Korea Meteorological Administration (KMA)


MV - Mikko Visa (MV), Finnish Meteorological 





- SO welcomed IMD (Kuldeep)





**2.	**Approve previous TC meeting minutes****


- Minutes of previous minutes approved.





**3. Review of Annual TC meeting actions**





  1. Ensure that all outstanding CLAs are completed (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/456)  


a.	BOM Status: BoM will be re-submit 


b.	Exeter Status: Completed.  MO to re-submit as Paul Rogers left organisation.


c.	MF Status: Submitted in September 2018


d.	Korean Status: Completed


e.	NWS Status: to be submitted and will update and the next TC meeting


f.	FMI Status: SO to chase FMI


g.	ECMWF Status: SO to chase 


h.	India Status: SO to chase





2.	Check CLA  Process with Paul Rogers (#457).  


    This is tied to (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/465)


    - Agreed to close the action.


3.	Check secure dropbox service options (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/465)


- Agreed  to leave open until decision on GDPR is known to inform wheher DropBox is required





4.	Alter code of conduct rules on website (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/466) 


  - This work is complete!





**5.	The following actions were reviewed and updated:**


- Update Technical Rules to clarify roles (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/172)


  It was confirmed that is In progress and agreed that list is comprehensive so that the list is adopted.





- Add software quality statement to Technical Rules (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/176)





    - BS - Need to ensure that the use of quality is flexible according to the project


    - SO - BS to update the statement to reflect flexibility of use


    - WQ - should we specific on which integration platform or should this be flexible


    - BS - I agree it should be flexible


    - SO - can we amend the text to reflect flexible and use Cloudbees and Jenkins as an example?


    - WQ - If the aim is consider software quality then we should be more general


     - SO - agreed


     **ACTION – SO to update statement on Technical rules and align web site page information on technical rules, code of conduct and development process.**





- Re-align web site pages on technical rules and development process (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/163)


  - SO – asked for comments on the draft process


  - All – no comments


  - SO – A general question on what information should information should on the Wikki vs the website?


  - DW – static documents should on the website and more fluid on Wkki, i.e. with a link from the web    site to the Wikki.


  - WQ – agree with DW


  - SO – Any comments


  - All – none


  - **ACTION All to comment on the word document to enable Steve to update document for approval at    the next TC meeting.** 





- Technical rules on how disputes on breach of technical rules are resolved should be      


        added (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/450)


  - This is closed!





- Obtain latest position on investigation on testing and test metrics (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/195)


    SO - any comments on the proposal from ED. 


    DW- the current tests relate to WIS1.  The question is whether the test result publication is a validation of WIS1 compliance.


    SO - This is intended to a measure of quality and how test automation.


    JA  - Is this for all projects, rather than just WIS1.


    SO -Yes.


    DW - Yes this could be used beyond WIS1, a generic approach. Suggested that we look at other projects and feedback.


    WQ - We have some automated testing in the CI process. But not clear how it fits with WIS1 e


    DW - I don’t we should be specific to WIS1 as this is the only criteria we have now and the Association will consider other projects. A generic statement would be good.


    SO - It would be good if its applies to WIS1 and can evolve


    DW - It would be good to keep this one and see what applies to WIS2 when more information on WIS2 is available.


    WQ - Keep WIS1 is maintenance mode. So should not be concerned with test metrics and review if there is a major issue.  The next round of GIS audits are being worked on but no detail yet.


    DW - can SO establish background from JT?


    SO - Agreed that SO will get more information from JT. ACTION


   SO – Can we discuss the effort required at a future PMC meeting? 


   ALL- agreed. 


**[Action-TC-2018-25 set up PMC agenda and meeting] (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/516)**





- Consider new goals for quality (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/451)


Agreed to discuss at next PMC





- Appoint new project lead for OpenWIS core (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/452)





  SO – BS and SO discussed potential candidates and skill sets.  The 


          outcome is a need for a  broad understanding of WIS1 and ability to 


          participate actively in PMCs.  Could not see someone obvious could 


          fulfil this.  So concluded that this would be worked up collectively at  


          each PMC and action taken by a number of individuals, appropriate.


   WQ -  this would work but a co-ordination role is useful.


   JA -  who is best to co-ordinate? SO and BS?


   SO and BS agreed


   SO - Agreed the use the model.


    


- Develop an approach to technical standards. 


   See Action-**TC-2018-1 cr**eate rules supplement on approach to technical standards


   BS - presented the proposal


   SO - suggested that people comment off-line and agree at the next TC.


   BS - Good to let everyone have more opportunity to feedback to make the right decision.


   WQ - This is dependent on specific needs of a project.  Its not the right time now,


   DW - agree with WQ but happy to go with BS recommendation so that no-one is discouraged. 


   BS - this is a request from SC. 


   WQ - in that case I agree with DW.  


   DW - Each organisation has it own standards as well.  This will the basis requirement.  


   SO - Need to review but accept BS’ recommendation re Apache or review further before committing to any aspect. 


   WQ - agree with DW but can delay the final decision.  They key point is that there is no requirement. 


   BS - Is the objective of OWA to start new projects? 


   WQ - yes.  


   BS - So if I am to promote OWA in MF, I need to understand the rules that would apply.  


   JA - it depends on the needs of the project. 


   DW - Strict rules could restrict potential projects.


   ALL - Agreed that further comment is needed before a final decision 





- Agreed that the release management process should be accessible (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/454)


  SO - presented the issue.  


  DW - is the action whether to publish items from the Wikki on the web site?


  SO - There are two points 1) process 2) Release Notes etc


  DW - can we try the proposed process on an OpenWIS project? 


  SO - Who manages the CI process.


  DW/JA- CI team using Jenkins.  There is a change to Jenkins which will be a separate issue.


  DW - what is needed for this action is how we can make the current process accessible.


  SO - Agreed.


  WQ - OK


  BS - OK


  **ACTION JA and SO to investigate what information is available and establish what DW has done in the past**





- Develop a repeatable process for quality (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/455)


  SO presented the issue. Does everyone agree that there are the proposed items are OK?


  JA - Yes, it is a good base-line.


  SO - Run out of time. 


  **ACTION - SO to create a demo for approval by TC and SC** 





- Set up of user forum (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/468)


  SO - Need understand who will be owner of the IP addresses and DNS for Discourse, to enable the Discourse service to be set up?


  DW - It may have been MFI


  BS - Quite possibly.


**ACTION SO to contact RGb** 





- Deploy the WIS2 PoC on AWS Servers in UKMO (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/issues/448)


   Agreed that JA should establish whether there are any costs





- Governance of OpenWIS 3x (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis-documentation/projects/8?add_cards_query=is%3Aopen)


All agreed that this will be discussed at the next PMC meeting





**6. Open Discussion**


  - What to do with Bug issues still open, and especially for:


    (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis/issues/288)


    (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis/issues/293)


    (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis/issues/294)


    (https://github.com/OpenWIS/openwis/issues/262) 


    


  Meeting ran out of time. 


    Agreed that this should be on the next PMC agenda





 - Proposal for the web site from BS


   - DW - agreed as it build on the agreed process, so can post on the web site.  


   - SO - can you add as an issue in Github? 


   - BS - Yes. Also allow SC to comment. 


   - ALL - agreed.


   - **ACTION - BS to raise the issue on Github**
